timeline.bodyText:
I think that adding the PsseVersionFilter annotation on each subclass of the PsseVersioned is error prone. It seems sufficient to add it once on PsseVersioned.
I'm not a big fan to add annotations that are used only for testing, but I suppose we cannot do anything else.
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Agree, adding the annotation at the PsseVersioned level is the right thing. You are right this annotation is only used for testing, but having it only once doesn't hurt and will ease the development and testing when we add support for new versions.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Could probably be improved by introducing a PsseBranch interface with all the required getters (getI(), getJ(), getK(), getR() and getX())
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: The ContainersMapping object that is using these functions is located in the iidm-api util package, and it is used to process in a generic way objects from different network models: IEEE CDF, Matpower, PSSE. An interface like this should be introduced at iidm-api level, and these external network models should implement it (adding a dependency to iidm).
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: This method is not used: will you use in a future pull request?
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: It is not needed. It was used in a previous stage of the refactoring. I have removed it.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if we should split this interface in two different interfaces. I think the implementation will result in huge files
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: I am not sure we have to split readers and writers. The implementation of read/write methods are quite compact, and seeing them together in the same class helps understanding the processing.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: I dislike this interface name: I think we should split this interface in two different interfaces.
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Ok, I am not against splitting readers and writers.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Could maybe lead to a performance issue: I would implement this using sets, but not sure if it's interesting here
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: The arrays used here are quite small, and the method is called only once per record group during write. But I will profile it using a big input file.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

replies.bodyText:
We have to keep in mind that order of elements in first array must be preserved. It is not really a set intersection, maybe the name of the method should be changed to keep(strings, stringsToKeep).
Agree that a possible optimisation would be to build  a Set from stringsToKeep and iterate over strings, keeping each item only if it is found in the stringsToKeep set.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: I we can prepare the design for newer version?
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Not sure if this is what you were suggesting: I added a switch clause with explicit V35 case. Rest of versions are unsupported at the moment.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Do you forgot something or is planned later? The mapping is filled but not used.
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Sorry, I wrote the code to try to fix an issue with Univocity when using Rates as a nested object in TransformerWinding that is nested in Transformer. Finally I decided to move the Rates directly as nested objects in Transformer to avoid the problem. I have removed the mapping, it is not needed.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: We should extract WindingHeaderTransformer and WindingRatesHeaderTransformer from this class because they are related to I/O
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: License header is missing
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: I like the way this can be expressed using assertj. Even people from junit recommend it (junit-team/junit5#2128). And we already have assertj in the project, is not a new dependency.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Would be more pretty to wrtie PsseVersion.isSupported(rev) or maybe a PsseVersion.checkVersion(rev) method
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Like it. PsseVersion now answers isVersionSupported(rev) and returns a string with all supportedVersions().
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText:
I don't know if it's recommanded or not to use static initializer. Maybe we can replace by an initialization like this:
private static final Map<Integer, PsseVersion> BY_NUMBER = Arrays.stream(values()).collect(Collectors.toMap(...));
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Agree, static initializer blocks makes sense only when more complex code is required.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: If you follow my advice, maybe the BY_NUMBER map is not needed anymore.
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: It is required to obtain the proper Enum value given an integer value read from the case. We want the version to be passed along the different methods that will manage the conversion using a specific type instead of a generic int.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: To be discussed: I notice that you create sub classes to support the v35 model. Maybe we should consider to have a single class for both version, but have access to the model version to throw exception when some getters/setters are not available. Something equivalent to what we have in the XIIDM parser
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Could it be null?
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: No, it never should be null. Parser should provide an empty string. Added Objects.requireNonNull.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Replace by a switch case to prepare to support additional versions. The default case should throw an exception
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Same remark
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Not sure that the super is needed
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Why this method is private package and the other one public?
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Fixed. Both read1 methods should be private package. Not expected to be used outside.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Why this method is private package and the other one public?
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Remove the this prefix
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Consider toString vs getMessage
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Adjusted, we log the ParsingContext and the Throwable error for easier identification of the potential problems.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Remove extra this prefix
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Remove extra this prefix
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Same remark
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Same remark
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Same remark
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Same remark
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Same remark
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: As explain previously, I would prefer to throw an exception instead of having a fall back. This would prepare the code for another version.
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: The name of this variable is not ok: it's more a content than a file. I wonder if it's a good idea to put the content in a string and if it's possible to read the input stream directly. Moreover, the input stream should be closed.
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText:
Agree. Changed the name of the variable. Used try-with-resources statement.
We were already investigating how to obtain json content without having to read the entire file. Current approach is valid only for the small test files we have now, but will fix it in separate PR, if you accept it.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

replies.bodyText: I change the code to pass the stream directly to the ObjectMapper().readTree() method instead of storing the content in a String. I'm pretty sure it doesn't change anything but it should be more efficient because the file won't be read twice (one time to fill the string, and one time by the parser).
replies.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Same remark
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Same remark
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Same remark
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Same remark
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Same remark
